Hi Paul,

I can see how this is possible; but, I am having trouble coming up with a
reproducible scenario.  From the stack trace it appears that you had the
plug-in manifest editor open on the (source) plugin.xml page and hovered 
over an element / attribute / object to trigger the exception.
Can you reproduce the problem?  If so, could you provide the plugin.xml file
you were using and the thing you hovered over?

In any event, I have added a boundary case to guard against the NPE.
Patch released to HEAD. I just want to verify that I indeed fixed the problem
(and not covering up some other problem)

I think the reason, nothing showed up in your log is because there is a
missing catch all block in TextViewerHoverManager - The thread is not 
guarded against NPEs.

Transferring over to the platform UI team to investigate that problem.
